metadata.Title: CVE-2022-41318 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A buffer over-read was discovered in libntlmauth in Squid 2.5 through 5.6.Due to incorrect integer-overflow protection, the SSPI and SMBauthentication helpers are vulnerable to reading unintended memorylocations. In some configurations, cleartext credentials from theselocations are sent to a client. This is fixed in 5.7.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-41318` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 4.10-1ubuntu1.7
squid-cgi - 4.10-1ubuntu1.7
squid-common - 4.10-1ubuntu1.7
squid-purge - 4.10-1ubuntu1.7
squidclient - 4.10-1ubuntu1.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.10-1ubuntu1.7').
